ETYMOLOGY: Compound of Middle English *every* (from Old English *ǣfre* 'ever') and *body* (from Old English *bodig*). It superseded the older 'every man'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: indefinite pronoun (always takes a singular verb)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Every person; all people in a specified group.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Everybody needs somebody to love, according to the song.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 正如歌中所唱，每个人都需要有人爱。
